intro: Conyza adolfi-friderici, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its small blue or purple flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Conyza adolfi-friderici is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and waste areas.
